title: Space Force unveils strategic plan for AI integration
summary:
"The Space Force recognizes the critical role that data and artificial intelligence will play in maintaining space superiority"

title: Welcome Home, Crew-9!
summary: NASA astronaut Butch Wilmore, left, Roscosmos cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov, second from left, and NASA astronauts Nick Hague, second from right, and Suni Williams, right, are all smiles as they wait to exit a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft on March 18, 2025. The four returned from a long-duration science expedition aboard the International Space Station, splashing down […]

title: Butch and Suni Return as Crew-10 Arrives on Station
summary: NASA and SpaceX’s Crew-10 mission, a long duration mission to the International Space Station, lifted off successfully at 7:03 pm on March 15, putting on a spectacular show for members of the press and those along the East Coast.

title: Interview with Michiharu Hyogo, Citizen Scientist and First Author of a New Scientific Paper
summary: Peer-reviewed scientific journal articles are the bedrock of science. Each one represents the culmination of a substantial project, impartially checked for accuracy and relevance – a proud accomplishment for any science team.  The person who takes responsibility for writing the paper must inevitably and repeatedly  write, edit, and rewrite its content as they receive comments […]

title: ESA Previews Euclid Mission’s Deep View of ‘Dark Universe’
summary: With contributions from NASA, the mission is looking back into the universe’s history to understand how the universe’s expansion has changed.  The Euclid mission — led by ESA (European Space Agency) with contributions from NASA — aims to find out why our universe is expanding at an accelerating rate. Astronomers use the term “dark energy” […]

title: Goodnight, Moon: NASA Cameras on Blue Ghost Capture Lunar Sunset
summary: This compressed, resolution-limited gif shows the view of lunar sunset from one of the six Stereo Cameras for Lunar-Plume Surface Studies (SCALPSS) 1.1 cameras on Firefly’s Blue Ghost lander, which operated on the Moon’s surface for a little more than 14 days and stopped, as anticipated, a few hours into lunar night. The bright, swirly […]

title: Exlabs and Antares form alliance to develop nuclear-powered spacecraft
summary:
Exlabs and Antares announced a strategic partnership March 19 to develop a nuclear-powered spacecraft for deep-space missions.
The post Exlabs and Antares form alliance to develop nuclear-powered spacecraft appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Portugal’s Astronaut for a Day Initiative Achieves Key Diversity Milestone
summary:
The Portuguese Space Agency has announced that its Astronaut for a Day initiative has reached a key diversity milestone, attracting more female applicants than male applicants for the first time. Launched in 2022, the Astronaut for a Day initiative is open to primary and secondary school students aged 14 to 18. Through a multi-stage selection […]
The post Portugal’s Astronaut for a Day Initiative Achieves Key Diversity Milestone appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Euclid opens data treasure trove, offers glimpse of deep fields
summary: On 19 March 2025, the European Space Agency’s Euclid mission released its first batch of survey data, including a preview of its deep fields. Here, hundreds of thousands of galaxies in different shapes and sizes take centre stage and show a glimpse of their large-scale organisation in the cosmic web.

title: Euclid is back – 26 million galaxies and counting
summary: The European Space Agency’s Euclid mission has scouted out the three areas in the sky where it will eventually provide the deepest observations of its mission.
